alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 6:05PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN LEWIS COUNTY THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 603 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Waltz, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Vanceburg, Head of Grassy, Camp Dix, Stricklett, Harris, Kinniconick, Tannery, and Emerson. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
